de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout

Class AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<CallbackType extends AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.AbstractTouchEventHandler
      • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<CallbackType>
  • Type Parameters:
    CallbackType - The type of the drag handler's callback
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<AbstractTouchEventHandler>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PhoneDragTabsEventHandler, TabletDragTabsEventHandler

    public abstract class AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<CallbackType extends AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback>
extends AbstractTouchEventHandler
    An abstract base class for all drag handlers, which allow to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback
      Defines the interface, a class, which should be notified about the events of a drag handler, must implement.
      static class  AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.DragState
      Contains all possible states of dragging gestures, which can be performed on a TabSwitcher.

      AbstractDragTabsEventHandler(TabSwitcher tabSwitcher, Arithmetics arithmetics, boolean swipeEnabled)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDragTabsEventHandler

        public AbstractDragTabsEventHandler(@NonNull
                                    TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                    @NonNull
                                    Arithmetics arithmetics,
                                    boolean swipeEnabled)
        Creates a new drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, whose tabs' positions and states should be calculated by the drag handler, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null
        arithmetics - The arithmetics, which should be used to calculate the position, size and rotation of tabs, as an instance of the type Arithmetics. The arithmetics may not be null
        swipeEnabled - True, if tabs can be swiped on the orthogonal axis, false otherwise

    • Method Detail

      • getArithmetics

        @NonNull
protected Arithmetics getArithmetics()
        Returns the arithmetics, which are used to calculate the positions, size and rotation of tabs.
        Returns:
        The arithmetics, which are used to calculate the positions, size and rotation of tabs, as an instance of the type Arithmetics. The arithmetics may not be null

      • getCallback

        @Nullable
protected CallbackType getCallback()
        Returns the callback, which should be notified about the drag handler's events.
        Returns:
        The callback, which should be notified about the drag handler's events, as an instance of the generic type CallbackType or null, if no callback should be notified

      • getFocusedItem

        protected abstract AbstractItem getFocusedItem(float position)
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to retrieve the item, which corresponds to the view, which is focused when clicking/dragging at a specific position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The item, which corresponds to the focused view, as an instance of the class AbstractItem or null, if no view is focused

      • onOvershootStart

        protected float onOvershootStart(float dragPosition,
                                 float overshootThreshold)
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when the tabs are overshooting at the start.
        Parameters:
        dragPosition - The position of the pointer on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        overshootThreshold - The position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the start currently starts at, in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The updated position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the start starts at, in pixels as a Float value

      • onOvershootEnd

        protected float onOvershootEnd(float dragPosition,
                               float overshootThreshold)
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when the tabs are overshooting at the end.
        Parameters:
        dragPosition - The position of the pointer on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        overshootThreshold - The position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the end currently starts at, in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The updated position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the end starts at, in pixels as a Float value

      • onOvershootReverted

        protected void onOvershootReverted()
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when an overshoot has been reverted.

      • onReset

        protected void onReset()
        The method, which invoked on implementing subclasses, when the drag handler has been reset.

      • isSwipeThresholdReached

        protected boolean isSwipeThresholdReached(@NonNull
                                          TabItem swipedTabItem)
        Returns, whether the threshold of a swiped tab item, which causes the corresponding tab to be removed, has been reached, or not.
        Parameters:
        swipedTabItem - The swiped tab item as an instance of the class TabItem. The tab item may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the threshold has been reached, false otherwise

      • setCallback

        public final void setCallback(@Nullable
                              CallbackType callback)
        Sets the callback, which should be notified about the drag handler's events.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback, which should be set, as an instance of the generic type CallbackType or null, if no callback should be notified

      • setDragState

        public final void setDragState(@NonNull
                               AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.DragState dragState)
        Sets the state of the currently performed drag gesture.
        Parameters:
        dragState - The state, which should be set, as a value of the enum AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.DragState. The state may not be null

      • handleDrag

        public final boolean handleDrag(float dragPosition,
                                float orthogonalPosition)
        Handles drag gestures.
        Parameters:
        dragPosition - The position of the pointer on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        orthogonalPosition - The position of the pointer of the orthogonal axis in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        True, if any tabs have been moved, false otherwise

      • isDragging

        public final boolean isDragging()
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns, whether a drag gesture is currently handled by the event handler, or not. This method may be overridden by subclasses, if multiple drag helpers are used.
        Overrides:
        isDragging in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns:
        True, if a drag gesture is currently handled by the event handler, false otherwise

        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler

        Parameters:

      • onDrag

        protected final void onDrag(@NonNull
                            android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to handle, when a drag gesture is performed.
        Specified by:
        onDrag in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - The last touch event of the drag gesture as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null

        public final void onUp(@Nullable
                       android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Handles, when a drag gesture has been ended.
        Specified by:
        onUp in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which ended the drag gesture, as an instance of the class MotionEvent or null, if no fling animation should be triggered
